Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch emphasized the significance of the game saying, 'These elimination games are incredible, everything that we've been playing for up to this point is now going to be on Saturday.'

Guardians' David Fry mentioned the challenge of facing Tarik Skubal, stating, 'I think we've seen him three or four times now this year, and I think we'll have a pretty good game plan to go against him.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was moved up to 1 p.m. ET due to inclement weather.
Teams that have won Game 4 when trailing 2-1 have a 56% chance of winning Game 5 and the series.
Others: Tigers: Justyn-Henry Malloy started as DH due to Kerry Carpenter's hamstring injury.
Guardians: Andrés Giménez moved down one spot in the order.
Tigers' Meadows has hit safely in six straight postseason games, a rare feat for a rookie.
Guardians' Fry was the hero in Game 4 with a go-ahead home run and a safety squeeze.
